channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid-19: France suspends 3,000 unvaccinated health workers
item.description: The country has made Covid-19 vaccination mandatory for all healthcare and care home workers.

item.title: Denmark set to ban life-term prisoners from new romantic links
item.description: The ban comes after a 17-year-old admitted to a romantic relationship with murderer Peter Madsen.

item.title: Marks & Spencer blames Brexit as it closes 11 French stores
item.description: Brexit has made it "near impossible" for it to supply fresh and chilled products to France, the retailer says.

item.title: French storms: Nine drown in choppy Mediterranean sea
item.description: Those who drowned in the dangerous conditions were all in their 50s, 60s and 70s.

item.title: Russian elections: How democratic are they?
item.description: Ahead of this week's elections many opposition candidates have been prevented from running.

item.title: Vincent Van Gogh: Newly discovered drawing goes on display
item.description: Study for Worn Out has been sitting in a Dutch family's private collection for more than a century.

item.title: Faroe Islands: Anger over killing of 1,400 dolphins in one day
item.description: Hunting is under scrutiny after more than 1,400 dolphins were killed in one day - a reported record.

item.title: Brussels to name street after murdered sex worker Eunice Osayande
item.description: The city aims to draw attention to victims of sexual violence after Eunice Osayande's death in 2018.

item.title: The Champions League team from Trans-Dniester
item.description: Sheriff Tiraspol are the 'kings' of Moldovan football, but their power and backing comes from a disputed territory on the Ukraine border.

item.title: Miss Ireland 2021: First black winner 'proud' of crown
item.description: Pamela Uba moved to the country as a seven-year-old - now she's making history after taking the title.

item.title: German election: Hunger strikers want greater action on climate change
item.description: Six young people say they won't end their hunger strike until the leading candidates meet them.

item.title: Russia election: Opposition crushed ahead of managed polls
item.description: Exiled or disqualified, opposition voices warn of a government stitch-up in this week’s elections.

item.title: Von der Leyen pushes for next level on EU defence
item.description: The European Commission President has called for the power to intervene militarily without the US.

item.title: Climate change: Cows 'toilet trained' in bid to curb greenhouse gases
item.description: By the end of the German study, more than two thirds of the cows were toilet trained.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... lorry driver shortages
item.description: Ros Atkins looks at why there's a lack of drivers and how it's affecting UK businesses.

item.title: Abba announce new album Voyage and virtual concerts in London
item.description: The Swedish group unveil their first new music in almost 40 years and shows in London from May 2022.

item.title: Irish society 'can begin to hope again', says Micheál Martin
item.description: The Taoiseach (Irish prime minister) announces plan to end most Covid-19 restrictions by 22 October.
